page.title: 04THE FARMER'S DAY IN SUMMER
page.content: THE FARMER RISES AT 6.30AM. FIRSTLY HE FEEDS THE CALVES AGED UP TO 6 MONTHS WITH POWDERED MILK-THIS USUALLY TAKES HIM ABOUT AN HOUR. AFTER THIS HE RETURNS FOR BREAKFAST.AFTER THIS HE DOES SEASONAL JOBS: {MAY-}HE MAKES SILAGE JUNE- HE MAKES HAY {JULY AND AUGUST-}HE COMBINES AND} HARVESTS THETHE CORN,WHEAT AND BARLEY. HE HAS THE HELP OF A {CONTRACTOR}DURING THE SEASON OF EXCESS WORK-A CONTRACTOR IS A MAN WHO IS PAID TO USE HIS OWN MACHINERY AND WORK THE LAND. THE CONTRACTOR WILL USUALLY OWN THE COMBINE AND OTHER ESSENTIAL MACHINERY. DURING THE AFTERNOON THE FARMER WILL HAVE HIS LUNCH. AFTER THIS HE WILL CONTINUE THE WORK HE WAS DOING IN THE MORNING.HE WILL ALSO FEED THE CALVES AGAIN AND THE REST OF THE ANIMALS.HE FINISHES WORK NO LATER THAN 9.00PM.
